thread.title: Report: NIKE and UT reach new 15-year deal
thread.title_full: Report: NIKE and UT reach new 15-year deal

title: Report: NIKE and UT reach new 15-year deal
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Report: NIKE and UT reach new 15-year deal The University of Texas reportedly reached an agreement with NIKE to remain the provider of shoes and apparel to the team. Post to Facebook Report: NIKE and UT reach new 15-year deal The University of Texas reportedly reached an agreement with NIKE to remain the provider of shoes and apparel to the team.  //kvue.tv/1LLENTj   Report: NIKE and UT reach new 15-year deal KVUE 11:16 a.m. CDT October 21, 2015 MILWAUKEE, WI - MARCH 20: The Texas Longhorns in their signature Nike shoes in the second half against the Arizona State Sun Devils during the game at BMO Harris Bradley Center on March 20, 2014 in Madison, Wisconsin. (Photo: Mike McGinnis, Getty Images) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
AUSTIN -- The University of Texas Longhorns have reportedly reached an a 15-year agreement with NIKE to remain the exclusive provider of shoe and apparel to the school, according to KVUE news partner the Austin American-Statesman . 
NIKE has been providing shoes and apparel to the Longhorns since 2000, but the deal was expiring soon and Under Armour was expected to make a push to try to woo Texas away from NIKE, Inc. 
However, UT canceled a planned presentation with Under Armour earlier this month and many saw that as NIKE being in the drivers seat to retain Texas. 
According to the Statesman , the deal will likely be the richest shoe/apparel deal in college athletics. The current benchmark was signed by NIKE this year with the University of Michigan Wolverines. The Michigan deal is believed to be worth more than $150 million. 
The Statesman reported that the reported contract will still have to be approved by the UT System Board of Regents. Read or Share this story: http://kvue.tv/1LLENTj TOP VIDEOS
